revised_title: Charles II: A Cautionary Tale of Mercury Poisoning
tldr: This article discusses the possibility that Charles II, who granted the Royal Society its charter, may have died from chronic mercury poisoning due to his scientific endeavors. The author examines Charles' symptoms and the potential consequences of his use of mercury without safety precautions, highlighting the importance of understanding the risks associated with scientific research.
